page.title: 13WEETON:COMMUTING FAMILIES
page.content: Weeton residents have inhabited the village for periods extending from 1 to 64 years.The village has expanded from 1 cottage (in 1920) to several (in 1985). Most people work at home or are retired.Occupations include housewife, farmworker and,in one case,antique dealer.The children (aged between 4 and 11) attend schools at North Rigton,Huby and Harrogate. Leisure time is spent gardening, watching T.V. or attending and helping with local organisations. All Weeton residents shop in Leeds or Harrogate weekly, using cars or buses as transport.There are transport problems, but residents feel these are outweighed by the beautiful countryside.
